awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Feasibility of a Wearable Blindness Prevention System
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader/commercial impact of this SBIR Phase II project aims to further advance novel wearable technology for glaucoma patients and prepare the technology for broad adoption. Glaucoma, the leading cause of irreversible blindness, has an unknown cause and affects more than 70 million people worldwide. Currently, there is no cure for glaucoma, but early can often save one’s vision. Eye pressure is the most commonly used measure for predicting and monitoring glaucoma. The wearable technology developed under this SBIR project will monitor eye pressure throughout the day and allow clinicians to provide a higher quality of care for at-risk patients. The technology uses photographs to measure how the eye stretches under high pressure.  This project aims to adapt the imaging technology into stylish eyeglass frames and develop custom software for converting photographs to eye pressure measurements, informing providers and improving compliance associated with at-home medication. 

This project aims to advance a novel technology in which wearable eyeglass frames are used to track intraocular pressure (IOP) by imaging the level of pressure-induced mechanical strain associated with the tissue at the front of the eye - specifically, exposed sclera.  IOP is, by far, the most commonly used metric for predicting glaucoma, the leading cause of irreversible blindness. In this project, a custom machine learning algorithm will identify characteristic patterns residing in small regions of the scleral images and, by tracking pressure-induced displacement of the regions, calculate IOP. The key objective of Phase II is to accurately measure IOP in real-world conditions with human in-vivo studies, incorporating necessary electronics in the frames. The technology will be further developed in order to improve correlation of the algorithm with conventional IOP captured during the image collection period.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Introduction

 

The successful culmination of Globe Biomedical's NSF SBIR Phase II/IIB project has led to the creation of Blink Frames, a pioneering wearable technology designed for ocular health monitoring. This project outcome report highlights the significant strides we have made in developing a product that not only meets but exceeds current standards in at-home patient monitoring.

 

Enhancing Doctor-Patient Connection through Advanced Monitoring

 

A major challenge in modern healthcare is the lack of information that doctors have about their patients outside of clinical settings. Blink Frames aims to solve this issue by providing doctors with continuous, real-time data that helps them monitor and treat ocular diseases more effectively. By giving healthcare providers more extensive patient data, Blink Frames enables a more informed and personalized approach to treatment.

 

Pioneering At-Home Monitoring with Blink Frames

 

Our response to the need for efficient at-home monitoring is embodied in the Blink Frames platform. This advanced system represents a significant leap in the field of wearable technology for health monitoring. The utilization of NSF funds has been instrumental in making our product not just lighter but also more capable than any other smart frame currently available in the market. This makes Blink Frames an ideal solution for patients seeking convenient and non-intrusive methods of ocular health monitoring.

 

Co-creation with Doctors and Patients

 

The design and functionality of Blink Frames have been shaped by extensive collaboration with both doctors and patients. This participatory approach has ensured that our product is not only medically effective but also user-friendly and desirable as a daily-wear accessory. Our focus has been on creating a device that people are comfortable and happy to wear, thereby ensuring consistent usage and reliable data collection.

 

Proven Accuracy and Reliability

 

After conducting thorough testing and validation, we have verified the accuracy and reliability of Blink Frames. These extensive trials have demonstrated the device's capability to offer precise and valuable insights into ocular health, which has helped establish its position as a dependable tool for both doctors and patients.

 

Expanding the Horizons of Ocular Wellness

 

In the future, we plan to broaden the use of Blink Frames beyond just treating Glaucoma. Our goal is to extend our reach to include a wider range of ocular diseases. Our commitment is to continuously explore new frontiers in ocular wellness and offer comprehensive solutions for various eye health issues.

 

Acknowledgments

 

We extend our deepest gratitude to the National Science Foundation for their support and funding, which has been pivotal in realizing this project. The NSF’s backing has not only enabled the technological advancement of Blink Frames but has also significantly contributed to our company’s growth and vision for future innovations in ocular health monitoring.

 

Conclusion

 

In conclusion, the development of Blink Frames marks a milestone in Globe Biomedical's journey, showcasing our commitment to advancing ocular health through innovative technology. With a foundation laid for future growth and exploration, we remain dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for those with ocular conditions, continuously striving to pioneer new frontiers in MedTech.



 

 


Last Modified: 12/15/2023
Modified by: Joshua J Park
